items.title: Liberals wait on right faction to decide on single challenger before spilling leadership
items.description: Liberal leadership aspirants Andrew Hastie and Angus Taylor are being urged to "sort out" which of them will challenge Sussan Ley for the party's top job before a spill is called.

items.title: Protests erupt in Minneapolis after second US citizen shot dead by agents
items.description: This is the second fatal shooting involving federal agents this month during a surge in immigration enforcement in the northern US city.

items.title: PM appoints next ambassador to US, says Trump's troops slur 'not acceptable'
items.description: Defence department boss Greg Moriarty is named the next ambassador to the United States, as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese criticises the US president's claim that allied troops did not serve on the front lines of Afghanistan.

items.title: Out-of-control bushfire in Victoria's Otways grows, threatens properties
items.description: An out-of-control bushfire continues to threaten communities in Victoria's Otways, as heatwave conditions continue in some parts of the state.

items.title: Air quality in Melbourne rated seventh worst in world due to bushfire smoke
items.description: A health warning is issued to Melbourne residents as the city is covered in smoke from a bushfire burning in the Otways, in Victoria's south-west.

items.title: Live: Djokovic sorry after almost hitting Australian Open ball kid
items.description: Novak Djokovic apologises for a "heat of the moment" incident during in his third-round match at the Australian Open. Follow live.

items.title: Meet the 2026 Australian of the Year nominees
items.description: Life-saving underwater amputations, decades of healthcare in refugee camps and fundraising campaigns for Australia's first astronaut – these are just a few of the achievements of the 2026 crop of Australian of the Year nominees.

items.title: Australia's most popular baby names from 2025 revealed
items.description: Abbey wanted a traditional, feminine name for her newborn daughter that would convey strength. Unwittingly, she chose one of the most popular baby names in Australia from 2025.

items.title: After a horror week of shark attacks, how do we sift facts from fear?
items.description: As a devoted ocean swimmer, I've learned to accept the risk of exploring an ocean that is not my natural habitat.

items.title: A British dual citizen's warning to hundreds of thousands looking to renew passports
items.description: As many British-Australian dual nationals grapple with new entry requirements, experts warn of exploitative and middleman websites.

items.title: Prince Harry sues the Daily Mail, but in the court of public opinion, he is on the stand
items.description: This week, Prince Harry traded the sunny West Coast for London to give evidence in a "super claim" against the publishers of the Daily Mail and the Mail on Sunday, Associated Newspapers.

items.title: 'I just had a feeling': A filmmaker's role in the search for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer
items.description: Rob Parsons amassed a following on YouTube for his videos of remote gold panning and mineral fossicking. Now, his attention is on the search for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer.

items.title: The 'disgust and hostility' that fuelled Shinzo Abe's assassin
items.description: The man who killed former Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe thought it was his life's mission to destroy a controversial church.

items.title: Chinese travellers once flocked to Australia. Then came the pandemic
items.description: Chinese visitor numbers have increased but are still below pre-pandemic levels, with economists warning ongoing economic uncertainty in China could dampen long-haul travel.

items.title: Australia Day event cancelled in Adelaide due to extreme heat
items.description: An annual Australia Day event in the Adelaide CBD has been cancelled ahead of potentially the hottest day in six years.

items.title: Promotional material for the movie Runt taken down in York
items.description: As one of Australia's most renowned authors faces child exploitation material charges, the town where one of his children's books was turned into a motion picture is grappling with the news.

items.title: Illegal tobacco boom exposes the demand problem behind WA’s black market
items.description: Much has been made of how the WA government is trying to stop the supply of illegal cigarettes, but its more difficult challenge is what can be done to ease demand.

items.title: Chaos, crowds and Kurt Cobain: Big Day Out's wild beginning
items.description: How the first Big Day Out in 1992 turned a risky idea into a landmark moment in Australian music history.

items.title: 'Heal the nation': Does Australia need to formally reckon with its past?
items.description: Ahead of the national debate around Indigenous rights and recognition this January 26, the ABC has spoken to First Nations leaders about what they think are the top priorities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

items.title: Residents wake up to assess damage from Tropical Cyclone Luana
items.description: Tropical Cyclone Luana weakens as it continues inland after crossing the northern WA coast.

items.title: Rod Laver's first arena: A backyard court where a legend was born
items.description: Like Donald Bradman’s tank stand, the backyard tennis court of Rod Laver’s youth has survived against the odds, but it is yet to be heritage listed.

items.title: Russia continues Ukraine attacks, as peace talks end without deal
items.description: Russian attacks on Ukraine have killed at least one person and wounded 31, as negotiators from both countries and the US met for a second day of peace talks. The meetings ended without a deal.

items.title: How Iranians' economic struggles left the regime unstuck
items.description: Decades of economic mismanagement and government corruption have widened wealth gaps in Iran, leaving ordinary Iranians calling for a revolution.

items.title: 'Highly unlikely' six people trapped by landslide have survived, NZ police say
items.description: After two days of holding out hope despite all the odds, the local police superintendent had the heart-wrenching job of announcing that no one trapped by the landslide at Mount Maunganui could have survived.

items.title: How the great Australian home ownership dream is aging
items.description: The average age of purchasing your first home is increasing as economists say politicians continue to favour the current home owner.
